well, by default Hardy has no icons on the desktop. But you can add Computer, Home, Network and Trash. As for text files and such, they would have been in the Home folder for your previous user
but when I dist-upgraded, all the icons stayed in place
to add Trash ext. to the Desktop, do an Alt+F2 and run  gconf-editor  , then navigate to  apps - nautilus - desktop
when hardy came out.. beginning of May. and the disappearance of desktop icons only happened a 2-3 days ago
ohh, not sure what would have caused that

hmm
can you see any contents in a terminal if you type:  ls -al ~/Desktop

very odd
that is what I told myself.. I hoped that after some restart or upgrade they come back, but they did not :/
try changing your wallpaper maybe
apart from that, I really have no idea

yeah, but it's worth changing just to see if it does change
ahhhh got it!
I once again tried the gconf key editor, I've un-ticked the "Show desktop" key, then exited. Then started the app again, ticked the "Swow desktop" key again, and now everything appeared!

excellent, glad to help
